verses.kjv: These be the words which Moses spake unto all Israel on this side Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against the Red sea, between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
verses.web: These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suf, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
verses.ct: These are the words that Moses spoke to all of Israel while they were east of the Jordan River, in the wilderness — in the Arabah near Suph, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.

verses.kjv: (There are eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of mount Seir unto Kadeshbarnea.)
verses.web: It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh Barnea.
verses.ct: (The journey from Horeb to Kadesh Barnea by way of Mount Seir takes only 11 days.)

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spake unto the children of Israel, according unto all that the LORD had given him in commandment unto them;
verses.web: In the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, Moses spoke to the children of Israel according to all that LORD had given him in commandment to them,
verses.ct: On the 1st day of the 11th month, in the 40th year of their journey, Moses addressed the people of Israel. He told them everything the LORD had commanded him to say.

verses.kjv: After he had slain Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, which dwelt at Astaroth in Edrei:
verses.web: after he had struck Sihon the king of the Amorites who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth, at Edrei.
verses.ct: This was after he had defeated Sihon, the Amorite king who ruled from Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan who ruled from Ashtaroth at Edrei.

verses.kjv: On this side Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,
verses.web: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses began to declare this law, saying,
verses.ct: There, east of the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain this law. He said:

verses.kjv: The LORD our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mount:
verses.web: “LORD our God spoke to us in Horeb, saying, ‘You have lived long enough at this mountain.
verses.ct: "The LORD our God spoke to us at Horeb and said, 'You've stayed at this mountain long enough.

verses.kjv: Turn you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the Amorites, and unto all the places nigh thereunto, in the plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the sea side, to the land of the Canaanites, and unto Lebanon, unto the great river, the river Euphrates.
verses.web: Turn, and take your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites and to all the places near there: in the Arabah, in the hill country, in the lowland, in the South, by the seashore, in the land of the Canaanites, and in Lebanon as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.
verses.ct: Break camp and head for the hill country of the Amorites and all the surrounding regions — the Arabah, the highlands, the lowlands, the Negev, and the coast — all the way through the land of the Canaanites and into Lebanon, as far as the great Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which the LORD sware unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.
verses.web: Behold, I have set the land before you. Go in and possess the land which LORD swore to your fathers—to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob—to give to them and to their offspring after them.’ ”
verses.ct: Look — I'm giving you this land. Go in and take possession of it. This is the land the LORD promised to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and to all their descendants after them.'"

verses.kjv: And I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:
verses.web: I spoke to you at that time, saying, “I am not able to bear you myself alone.
verses.ct: "At that time I told you, 'I can't carry the weight of leading all of you by myself.

verses.kjv: The LORD your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.
verses.web: LORD your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are today as the stars of the sky for multitude.
verses.ct: The LORD your God has made you so numerous that today you're as countless as the stars in the sky.

verses.kjv: (The LORD God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you!)
verses.web: LORD, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times as many as you are and bless you, as he has promised you!
verses.ct: (May the LORD, the God of your ancestors, multiply you a thousand times over and bless you just as he promised!)

verses.kjv: How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
verses.web: How can I myself alone bear your problems, your burdens, and your strife?
verses.ct: But how can I handle all your problems, your burdens, and your disputes on my own?

verses.kjv: Take you wise men, and understanding, and known among your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.
verses.web: Take wise men of understanding who are respected among your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.”
verses.ct: Choose wise, discerning, and respected men from each of your tribes, and I'll appoint them as your leaders."

verses.kjv: And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good for us to do.
verses.web: You answered me, and said, “The thing which you have spoken is good to do.”
verses.ct: You agreed and said, "That's a good plan. Let's do it."

verses.kjv: So I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and officers among your tribes.
verses.web: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and respected men, and made them heads over you, captains of thousands, captains of hundreds, captains of fifties, captains of tens, and officers, according to your tribes.
verses.ct: So I selected the leading men of your tribes — wise and respected — and appointed them over you as commanders of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, along with other officials for each tribe.

verses.kjv: And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear the causes between your brethren, and judge righteously between every man and his brother, and the stranger that is with him.
verses.web: I commanded your judges at that time, saying, “Hear cases between your brothers and judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the foreigner who is living with him.
verses.ct: I also gave your judges clear instructions at that time: "Listen carefully to disputes among your people and judge fairly — whether the case involves a fellow Israelite or a foreigner living among you.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not respect persons in judgment; but ye shall hear the small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man; for the judgment is God’s: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring it unto me, and I will hear it.
verses.web: You shall not show partiality in judgment; you shall hear the small and the great alike. You shall not be afraid of the face of man, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too hard for you, you shall bring to me, and I will hear it.”
verses.ct: Don't show favoritism in your rulings. Give the same hearing to the powerless as you do to the powerful. Don't be intimidated by anyone, because judgment belongs to God. If any case is too difficult for you, bring it to me and I'll handle it."

verses.kjv: And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.
verses.web: I commanded you at that time all the things which you should do.
verses.ct: At that time I gave you instructions for everything you needed to do.

verses.kjv: And when we departed from Horeb, we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the LORD our God commanded us; and we came to Kadeshbarnea.
verses.web: We traveled from Horeb and went through all that great and terrible wilderness which you saw, by the way to the hill country of the Amorites, as LORD our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh Barnea.
verses.ct: Then we left Horeb and traveled through that vast and terrifying wilderness — the one you remember well — on the road toward the Amorite hill country, just as the LORD our God had commanded. Eventually we arrived at Kadesh Barnea.

verses.kjv: And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the Amorites, which the LORD our God doth give unto us.
verses.web: I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites, which LORD our God gives to us.
verses.ct: When we got there, I told you, "You've reached the hill country of the Amorites, which the LORD our God is giving to us.

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD thy God hath set the land before thee: go up and possess it, as the LORD God of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.
verses.web: Behold, LORD your God has set the land before you. Go up, take possession, as LORD the God of your fathers has spoken to you. Don’t be afraid, neither be dismayed.”
verses.ct: Look — the LORD your God has placed this land right in front of you. Go up and take it, just as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, told you. Don't be afraid, and don't lose heart."

verses.kjv: And ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, We will send men before us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring us word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we shall come.
verses.web: You came near to me, everyone of you, and said, “Let’s send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and bring back to us word of the way by which we must go up, and the cities to which we shall come.”
verses.ct: But all of you came to me and said, "Let's send men ahead to scout out the land. They can report back on the best route to take and which cities we'll encounter."

verses.kjv: And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:
verses.web: The thing pleased me well. I took twelve of your men, one man for every tribe.
verses.ct: That sounded like a good idea to me, so I chose 12 men — one from each tribe.

verses.kjv: And they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the valley of Eshcol, and searched it out.
verses.web: They turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.
verses.ct: They set out into the hill country and made their way to the valley of Eshcol, where they explored the area.

verses.kjv: And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, It is a good land which the LORD our God doth give us.
verses.web: They took some of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down to us, and brought us word again, and said, “It is a good land which LORD our God gives to us.”
verses.ct: They brought back some of the land's fruit and gave us their report: "It's a good land that the LORD our God is giving us."

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding ye would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God:
verses.web: Yet you wouldn’t go up, but rebelled against the commandment of LORD your God.
verses.ct: But you refused to go up. You rebelled against the command of the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: And ye murmured in your tents, and said, Because the LORD hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.
verses.web: You murmured in your tents, and said, “Because LORD hated us, he has brought us out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites to destroy us.
verses.ct: You grumbled in your tents and said, "The LORD hates us! That's why he brought us out of Egypt — to hand us over to the Amorites and let them destroy us.

verses.kjv: Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.
verses.web: Where are we going up? Our brothers have made our heart melt, saying, ‘The people are greater and taller than we. The cities are great and fortified up to the sky. Moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakim there!’ ”
verses.ct: Where are we supposed to go? Our own scouts have terrified us! They said the people there are bigger and taller than we are, the cities are massive with walls reaching to the sky, and they even saw descendants of the Anakim there!"

verses.kjv: Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.
verses.web: Then I said to you, “Don’t be terrified. Don’t be afraid of them.
verses.ct: So I told you, "Don't be terrified. Don't be afraid of them.

verses.kjv: The LORD your God which goeth before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes;
verses.web: LORD your God, who goes before you, he will fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
verses.ct: The LORD your God is going ahead of you. He will fight for you, just like he did in Egypt — you saw it with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: And in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that the LORD thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way that ye went, until ye came into this place.
verses.web: and in the wilderness where you have seen how that LORD your God carried you, as a man carries his son, in all the way that you went, until you came to this place.”
verses.ct: And in the wilderness, you saw how the LORD your God carried you the entire way, like a father carries his son, all the way to this place."

verses.kjv: Yet in this thing ye did not believe the LORD your God,
verses.web: Yet in this thing you didn’t believe LORD your God,
verses.ct: But even after all that, you still didn't trust the LORD your God —

verses.kjv: Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, to shew you by what way ye should go, and in a cloud by day.
verses.web: who went before you on the way, to seek out a place for you to pitch your tents in: in fire by night, to show you by what way you should go, and in the cloud by day.
verses.ct: the same God who traveled ahead of you to find places for you to camp, guiding you with fire at night and a cloud by day to show you which way to go.

verses.kjv: And the LORD heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,
verses.web: LORD heard the voice of your words and was angry, and swore, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD heard your complaining and was furious. He made an oath, saying,

verses.kjv: Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation see that good land, which I sware to give unto your fathers,
verses.web: “Surely not one of these men of this evil generation shall see the good land which I swore to give to your fathers,
verses.ct: "Not a single person from this evil generation will see the good land I swore to give your ancestors —

verses.kjv: Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath wholly followed the LORD.
verses.web: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh. He shall see it. I will give the land that he has trodden on to him and to his children, because he has wholly followed LORD.”
verses.ct: except Caleb son of Jephunneh. He will see it, and I will give him and his descendants the land he explored, because he followed the LORD wholeheartedly."

verses.kjv: Also the LORD was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not go in thither.
verses.web: Also LORD was angry with me for your sakes, saying, “You also shall not go in there.
verses.ct: The LORD was also angry with me because of you. He told me, "You won't enter that land either.

verses.kjv: But Joshua the son of Nun, which standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: encourage him: for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
verses.web: Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, shall go in there. Encourage him, for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
verses.ct: But Joshua son of Nun, your assistant, will enter it. Encourage him, because he's the one who will lead Israel to take possession of the land.

verses.kjv: Moreover your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, and your children, which in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
verses.web: Moreover your little ones, whom you said would be captured or killed, your children, who today have no knowledge of good or evil, shall go in there. I will give it to them, and they shall possess it.
verses.ct: As for your little ones — the children you claimed would be taken captive — your sons and daughters who don't yet know right from wrong, they will be the ones to enter. I will give the land to them, and they will possess it.

verses.kjv: But as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.
verses.web: But as for you, turn, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
verses.ct: But you — turn around and head back into the wilderness toward the Red Sea."

verses.kjv: Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the LORD, we will go up and fight, according to all that the LORD our God commanded us. And when ye had girded on every man his weapons of war, ye were ready to go up into the hill.
verses.web: Then you answered and said to me, “We have sinned against LORD. We will go up and fight, according to all that LORD our God commanded us.” Every man of you put on his weapons of war, and presumed to go up into the hill country.
verses.ct: Then you said to me, "We have sinned against the LORD. We'll go up and fight, just as the LORD our God commanded us." So each of you strapped on your weapons and assumed you could march right up into the hill country.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight; for I am not among you; lest ye be smitten before your enemies.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Tell them, ‘Don’t go up and don’t fight; for I am not among you, lest you be struck before your enemies.’ ”
verses.ct: But the LORD told me, "Warn them: 'Don't go up and don't fight, because I am not with you. If you do, your enemies will crush you.'"

verses.kjv: So I spake unto you; and ye would not hear, but rebelled against the commandment of the LORD, and went presumptuously up into the hill.
verses.web: So I spoke to you, and you didn’t listen; but you rebelled against the commandment of LORD, and were presumptuous, and went up into the hill country.
verses.ct: I passed along the warning, but you wouldn't listen. You defied the LORD's command and arrogantly marched up into the hills anyway.

verses.kjv: And the Amorites, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir, even unto Hormah.
verses.web: The Amorites, who lived in that hill country, came out against you and chased you as bees do, and beat you down in Seir, even to Hormah.
verses.ct: The Amorites who lived in those hills swarmed out against you and chased you like a swarm of bees. They cut you down all through Seir, driving you as far as Hormah.

verses.kjv: And ye returned and wept before the LORD; but the LORD would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.
verses.web: You returned and wept before LORD; but LORD didn’t listen to your voice, nor turn his ear to you.
verses.ct: You came back and wept before the LORD, but the LORD would not listen to you. He refused to hear your cries.

verses.kjv: So ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye abode there.
verses.web: So you stayed in Kadesh many days, according to the days that you remained.
verses.ct: So you stayed at Kadesh for a long time — as long as you remained there.
